item.description:

item.title: Nascar Fans Can Win A Daytona 500 Race Package
item.description:
A new online poker/casino site is offering Nascar fans a chance to win a race package to the prestigious Daytona 500 on Feb 18, 2007 at Daytona Beach. The race lounge is dedicated to fans who may not only love Nascar but also the thrill of poker. (PRWEB May 24, 2006)
Trackback URL: http://www.prweb.com/chachingpr.php/TWFnbi1UaGlyLVByb2YtQ3Jhcy1IYWxmLVplcm8=

item.title: Wife Takes Prized Fisherman's Map in Divorce
item.description:
After 30 years of work the map printing plates were lost. How valuable were the surviving copies? One man's angling wife demanded the map as part of her divorce settlement. At 91, the map creator worked with a publisher to get the map republished. Now new state stream and lake maps are available. Some deserving husbands could even receive one for Father's Day (PRWEB May 24, 2006)
Trackback URL: http://www.prweb.com/chachingpr.php/RmFsdS1Mb3ZlLVNpbmctUHJvZi1IYWxmLVplcm8=

item.title: CyberDefender CEO Gary Guseinov Supports Thirteenth Annual Race to Erase Multiple Sclerosis
item.description:
CyberDefender(tm) Corporation, the security developer with the industry’s most advanced early defense technology today announced that its Chief executive Officer Gary Guseinov attended the Thirteenth Annual Race to Erase MS entitled Disco Fever to Erase MS benefiting The Nancy Davis Foundation for Multiple Sclerosis on May 12th, 2006 at the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza. The Gala evening featured a dazzling live and silent auction, gourmet dinner, and live performances by Kool & The Gang, Sister Sledge and Natalie Cole, among others. (PRWEB May 24, 2006)
Trackback URI: http://www.prweb.com/dingpr.php/RmFsdS1UaGlyLUVtcHQtUHJvZi1IYWxmLVplcm8=

item.title: The Dunkadelic Origin, All-Dunkadelic Teams, and the "Dunkadelic Era" In America, 1984-Present Shows the Growing Popularity of the Term
item.description:
NBA Commissioner David Stern, Russell Simmons, Rick Rubin, RUN-DMC, and the "Air Jordans" helped create the "Basketball and Hip-Hop" culture fusion The "Dunkadelic Era" In America, 1984-Present. 2nd Annual 2006 All-Dunkadelic Team, and 1st Annual 2006 College All-Dunkadelic Team will be announced June 29th. Dunkadelic for her is simply "Dunkadelicious." (PRWEB May 24, 2006)

item.description:

item.title: Eye On Gambling (EOG.com): USA Embraces The Other Football
item.description:
It was only a matter of time before the United States became a world soccer power. Between the millions of immigrants from traditional soccer-playing countries and the millions of soccer moms populating America’s roadways, the Beautiful Game has spread like a nasty virus in the very country that prides itself in ridiculing the sport. (PRWEB May 24, 2006)

item.description: Window Canvas® is excited to announce their new collegiate logo program in partnership with Ontario, CA based automotive after market provider EGR, Inc. (PRWEB May 24, 2006)

item.title: Deep Blue Yachts Supply, Inc. Unveils Cutting Edge Yacht Supply Website
item.description: Deep Blue Yacht Supply, Inc. today announced the opening of their new online storefront. This revolutionary wholesale company offers sale items to the public at prices that up until now have not been available to the retail yachting consumer. Their mission is to provide all customers with the highest quality yacht supplies at the absolute lowest prices in the industry. (PRWEB May 24, 2006)

item.title: Athletic Scholarship Corporation Increases Community Commitment in a Program with Jump Stretch Inc.
item.description: Athletic Scholarship Corporation has announced they have designed a program to invest proceeds from area school districts nationwide with Jump Stretch Inc, to offer Jump Stretch’s Flex Bands® and ballistic training programs to high schools nationwide. (PRWEB May 24, 2006)

item.title: Hawk Planners Sees Growth Because of Rise in Youth Sports Participation in 2005
item.description:
According to Matt Hawk, creator of Hawk Planners, growth of youth sports isn’t limited to the United States. Companies like Hawk Planners, which produces planning books for coaches, have begun to see sales growth in countries outside the United States. (PRWEB May 23, 2006)

item.title: 2006 World Cup of "Table Soccer" Kicks Off in Hamburg, Germany - U.S. National "Foosball" Team Expected to Dominate
item.description: While the U.S. National Soccer Team has made tremendous strides in international competition over the last 15 years (even achieving a world ranking as high as fifth) most soccer enthusiasts don’t believe the U.S. team has any real chance of winning the upcoming FIFA World Cup. However, the U.S. National TABLE Soccer Team, whose players have captured a combined total of well over 20 World and 100 Major tour titles, is widely expected to dominate the World Cup – of "Foosball." Yes, you read that right: foosball, a.k.a. “table soccer.” You know, that game with miniature soccer men attached to rods that spin around to hit a little ball on a kitchen table sized soccer field. As it turns out there’s much more to it than that, and you’ll be able to see for yourself May 25-28, 2006 at the famed Fischauktionshalle in Hamburg, Germany, where about 200 of the world’s most elite foosball players will compete for the International Table Soccer Federation (ITSF) World Cup title. (PRWEB May 23, 2006)

item.title: Results of U-FLI Western Qualifier
item.description: The United Flyball League International (U-FLI) recently held the first ever North American Flyball Championships Qualifier. This was the first of three qualification tournaments spread across North America in which Flyball teams compete in divisions based on their best times. The top two teams from each division advance to the Final Championship tournament to be held in Mesquite, Texas where they will race the top two teams from the other qualification tournaments resulting in a final champion being designated in each division. (PRWEB May 23, 2006)

item.title: New Fully-Supported Hunterdon County Bike Ride to Benefit Local Cancer Care Charity; Registration Now Open for June 25 Carpe Diem Ride in Frenchtown, NJ
item.description:
The Carpe Diem Ride offers top-notch rider support and great routes from 18 to 100 miles for riders of all skill levels. $50 registration fee is all it takes to ride. Larger donations welcome and encouraged. Proceeds benefit the Paul R. Nardoni Foundation in Flemington, NJ, and the Lance Armstrong Foundation. (PRWEB May 22, 2006)
Trackback URL: http://www.prweb.com/chachingpr.php/Q3Jhcy1GYWx1LUhvcnItQ3Jhcy1IYWxmLVplcm8=

item.title: Online Gambling and Sports Betting Continues with its Unprecedented Growth Despite US Efforts
item.description:
Despite efforts of the USA, the online gambling, casino and sports betting markets are on their way to attracting over $8 billion annually from US bettors alone. It comes as no surprise that online casinos and sports book web sites are coming and going all the time. (PRWEB May 22, 2006)
Trackback URL: http://www.prweb.com/chachingpr.php/SGFsZi1Db3VwLUZhbHUtQ3Jhcy1IYWxmLVplcm8=

item.title: MundiTone Launches the First Soccer Mobile Content Website with a Special Cellular Content for the 2006 FIFA World Cup in Germany
item.description:
MundiTone, a Mobile Content provider that focuses on Soccer, is kicking off with special mobile content for the 2006 FIFA World Cup in Germany. MundiTone's offer includes mobile ringtones, videotones, icons, and wallpapers of all the leading football teams and players. (PRWEB May 22, 2006)

item.title: SneakerCut.com Wants to Command the Nike, adidas, and Bape Sta Exclusive Shoe Collectors Market Online
item.description: SneakerCut.com sees amazing growth in their first quarter of opening. Nike, Jordan brand, adidas, Bape Sta, and other exclusive shoe and clothing product wearers are hailing the site as a fresh air to their shoe boxes. The exclusive shoe club wants to see 100 members join per month and say its very possible. (PRWEB May 22, 2006)

item.title: The art of grappling, i4u Museum announces special exhibition of an important 16th Century Japanese painting of Sumo wrestling
item.description:
A 16th Century Japanese hand scroll illustrating 36 sumo wrestling moves will be debuted by i4u Museum in May, 2006. All 36 sumo wrestling moves are displayed at the Online Museum with clearly digitized photos so that all viewers have the benefit of close-up study of each grappling move. Never before in history has classic Japanese sumo wrestling art been presented to the general public in such a close-up and vivid format, thanks to internet technologies. (PRWEB May 21, 2006)
Trackback URL: http://www.prweb.com/chachingpr.php/TG92ZS1QaWdnLUhvcnItQ3Jhcy1IYWxmLVplcm8=

item.title: Paramount Hotel New York Serves Up U.S. Open Special
item.description:
Calling all tennis fans! The Paramount Hotel New York wants to help you enjoy the United State’s premiere tennis tournament by offering, from August 28 to September 5, 2006, a special rate of $195 per night for superior accommodations to all fans attending the U.S. Open in Flushing Meadow Corona Park in Queens. (PRWEB May 21, 2006)

item.title: Women’s Pro Football Scores With AFA Hall of Fame
item.description:
The National Women’s Football Association is pleased to announce that Founder and CEO, Catherine Masters will be inducted into the American Football Association Hall of Fame on June 10th in Canton, Ohio. (PRWEB May 21, 2006)
Trackback URI: http://www.prweb.com/zingpr.php/UGlnZy1QaWdnLVN1bW0tQ3Jhcy1IYWxmLVplcm8=

item.title: Natural Fibers Beat Synthetics in New Fabric
item.description: Micro Equity Group Associates [MEGA] has released EckoTech, an advanced, all natural fiber fabric with anti-odor, antibacterial, wicking and breathing properties that are far superior to available synthetics. First usage is in sweaters and other knit sporting garments, but MEGA plans to expand production to support fashion markets shortly. (PRWEB May 21, 2006)

item.title: Seven Year Old Set to Break Record for Alcatraz Swim
item.description: Seven year old Glendale, Arizona resident Braxton Bilbrey is planning to break the record for youngest person ever to swim from Alcatraz Island to San Francisco on Monday, May 22nd. He is being coached by Joe Zemaitis, a professional triathlete and accomplished open water swimmer. Braxton practices in the pool four days a week at the Camelback Village Health Club and Spa. He is using his record breaking swim to raise money and awareness for drowning prevention programs in Arizona. (PRWEB May 21, 2006)

item.title: JumpingJockey.com Brings Tipster Services Into The 21st Century
item.description: Daily service launched by JumpingJockey.com provides lay and back tips for both long and short priced favourites as well as value/outsider bets. (PRWEB May 21, 2006)
